Description: A thin copper pin: of circular section, with the point preserved.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' II, 28, see pl.IXA, 5. For other examples of Early Dynastic copper pins, see W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' II, pls.XXXV, 93-5; XXXVIII, 92; XIIV, 11, 48; ; E. Amélineau, ‘Les Nouvelles Fouilles d’Abydos’ II (1896-7), pl.XVIII, 2; J. de Morgan, ‘Recherches sur les Origines de l’Égypte II (Paris, 1896-7), 252, figs. 842-5, 847-50; A. C. Mace in G. A. Reisner (ed.), 'The early dynastic cemeteries of Naga-ed-Dêr' II, (California, 1908), pl.48a; Z. Y. Saad, 'The excavations at Helwan art and civilization in the first and second Egyptian dynasties' (Norman, 1969), pl.37.
